Package controller.project.single_project

Class ProjectStatusController

java.lang.Object
controller.FrameController
controller.project.single_project.ProjectController
controller.project.single_project.ProjectStatusController
All Implemented Interfaces:
CloseablePropertyChangeListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
public class ProjectStatusController
extends ProjectController
implements CloseablePropertyChangeListener
ProjectStatusController handles all the events related to the status change of the project, including handling the clicks on any of the related buttons, and updateing the ui if the status of the project has changed.
Author:
Bori Fazakas

  • Field Summary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.EnumSet<ProjectStatusButtonsPanel.ButtonType> getNecessaryButtonTypes()  
    java.util.List<PropertyChangeObservable> getPropertyChangeObservables()  
    void markProgress()
    If legal, marks the status of the project as IN_PROGRESS, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.
    void propertyChange​(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent propertyChangeEvent)
    Updates the UI if the status, assignee or supervisor of the project have changed.
    void review()
    If legal, marks the status of the previously turned-in project as FINISHED, if accepted, or TO_DO or IN_PROGRESS, based on the option chosen by the user in the dialog, if not accepted, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.
    void setBackToToDo()
    If legal, marks the status of the project as TO_DO, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.
    void turnIn()
    If legal, marks the status of the project as TURNED_IN, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.
    void undoTurnIn()
    If legal, marks the status of the previously turned-in project as TO_DO or IN_PROGRESS, based on the option chosen by the user in the dialog, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.

  • Method Details

    • markProgress

      public void markProgress()
      If legal, marks the status of the project as IN_PROGRESS, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.

    • setBackToToDo

      public void setBackToToDo()
      If legal, marks the status of the project as TO_DO, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.

    • turnIn

      public void turnIn()
      If legal, marks the status of the project as TURNED_IN, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.

    • undoTurnIn

      public void undoTurnIn()
      If legal, marks the status of the previously turned-in project as TO_DO or IN_PROGRESS, based on the option chosen by the user in the dialog, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.

    • review

      public void review()
      If legal, marks the status of the previously turned-in project as FINISHED, if accepted, or TO_DO or IN_PROGRESS, based on the option chosen by the user in the dialog, if not accepted, and handles the exceptions if the operation is illegal.

    • getNecessaryButtonTypes

      public java.util.EnumSet<ProjectStatusButtonsPanel.ButtonType> getNecessaryButtonTypes()
      Returns:
      set of the buttons corresponding to the status change actions available to the current user based on the status of the project and the role of the user.
